Firebase Data Storage

Firebase Realtime Database

I have successfully utilized Firebase Realtime Database to store my published app's data in a JSON style format and only allow read/write functionality to authenicated users as an added security measure. Realtime Database is a cloud-hosted NoSQL database with SDK support for iOS, Android, and the web. The benefits for using Firebase's Realtime Database is that data synchronization uses web sockets, allowing for very snappy transactions. Realtime Database also handles updates for you when a device is offline, syncing changes for you when the network reconnects.
